results.title: For the record - George Best: a profile
results.brief_description: A profile of George Best (interviewed by Michael Parkinson), his origins in Belfast, family background, and his “pop-star” status as a gifted footballer. Includes football footage and interviews with family friends and club representatives. Emphasises the competing elements in his life, his status as a footballer versus his celebrity status.

results.title: For the love of dance
results.creator_credit: Cynthia Scott, David Wilson, John Smith, Michael McKennirey, Adam Symansky, Cynthia Scott/Canada Council and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A backstage look at Canada’s burgeoning dance industry, with seven of the country’s top professional dance companies. Filmed on location across North America, this documentary records the exacting daily grind of whistle-stop tours, exhausting repetitive practice, and little rest. Colourful excerpts highlight each troupe’s unique repertoire, as dancers give dazzling displays of physical control and grace. It is a moving tribute to the thousands of dancers who strive for perfection every day. Narrated by Adrienne Clarkson. (Awards: New York; Ronda-Malaga) N.B. Two minutes of footage is missing from the beginning of this film.

results.title: For the love of a child
results.creator_credit: Douglas Stanley and Nomad Films International
results.brief_description: Documentary film showing how birth by the natural method can be a beautiful experience in communication and togetherness for the whole family. It illustrates the need for proper mental and physical preparation.

results.title: For peace of mind
results.creator_credit: Fiona Banks, Hilary Christmas, Australia. Dept. of Health, Housing and Community Services, Film Victoria and Tanglefoot Productions
results.brief_description: A creative video set in rural Victoria, which revolves around two friends, Maureen and Fay, and Maureen’s daughter Di. The program targets women over 50, promotes the benefits of having a Pap Smear on a regular basis and deals with the barriers women face to having them. The storyline is interwoven with professional opinions from experts and practitioners in women’s health, and reveals commonly held attitudes to the subject by women in this age group.

results.title: For land's sake
results.creator_credit: Hugh Foulds, Don Worobey, John Taylor, Peter Jones and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Buying land to build a house on can be a problem. Urban sprawl, unscrupulous developers, zoning laws and other bureaucratic complexities can dim the enthusiasm of even the hardest candidates. Using animation and humour we are shown the difficulties encountered by a couple who want to build “a little house out in the country”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Hugh Foulds, Don Worobey, John Taylor, Peter Jones and ONF | NFB
